case_vignette: A 45-year-old man with a past medical history of hypertension presents with concerns of a rash on his left thigh back that his wife noticed two days ago. The rash has been progressively enlargened. Patient denies any pain or any prior treatments. He thinks the surrounding skin is warm and may be infected, but he denies any drainage.  He reports that they went hiking eight days ago in Rhode Island.   Physical exam demonstrates a non-scaly large targetoid, pink-red patch on the left thigh. The patient is afebrile. multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on the back of my left thigh that has been getting bigger, and the skin around it feels warm.
How long have you had this rash, and did anything specific seem to trigger it?
I noticed the rash two days ago, and I think it might be related to a hiking trip I went on eight days ago in Rhode Island.
Have you had any fever, chills, or other systemic symptoms recently?
No, I haven't had any fever or chills.
Is the rash painful or itchy?
The rash is not painful.
Does the rash have a circular shape with a clearer center, and what color is it?
Yes, the rash has a circular shape with a clearer center and is pink-red in color.
Do you have any known tick bites or seen any ticks on you during or after your hiking trip?
I haven't noticed any tick bites or seen any ticks on me during or after the hiking trip.
Do you have any allergies or medical conditions that may cause skin reactions?
I have a past medical history of hypertension, but no known allergies that cause skin reactions.
Final Diagnosis: Erythema migrans (Lyme disease)
